Title: Silence of the Lambs
Description: A young FBI cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Jonathan Demme
Director.Bio: Robert Jonathan Demme was an American director, producer, and screenwriter.

Title: Legally Blonde
Description: Elle Woods, a fashionable sorority queen, is dumped by her boyfriend. She decides to follow him to law school. While she is there, she figures out that there is more to her than just looks.

Genre.Name: Romantic Comedy
Genre.Description: Also known as a 'rom-com', Romantic comedy is a subgenre of comedy and slice of life fiction, focusing on lighthearted, humorous plot lines centered on romantic ideas, such as how true love is able to surmount most obstacles.

Director.Name: Jonathan Luketic
Director.Bio: Robert Luketic is an Australian director, producer, and screenwriter.

Title: The Nightmare Before Christmas
Description: Jack Skellington, the King of Halloween Town, stumbles upon Christmas Town and schemes to take over the holiday.

Genre.Name: Animated
Genre.Description: Animation is a method in which pictures are manipulated to appear as moving images. In traditional animation, images are drawn or painted by hand on transparent celluloid sheets to be photographed and exhibited on film.

Director.Name: Henry Selick
Director.Bio: Charles Henry Selick Jr. is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, production designer, and animator.

Title: Coraline
Description: A young girl discovers an idealized parallel universe behind a secret door in her new home, unaware that it contains a dark and sinister secret.

Genre.Name: Animated
Genre.Description: Animation is a method in which pictures are manipulated to appear as moving images. In traditional animation, images are drawn or painted by hand on transparent celluloid sheets to be photographed and exhibited on film.

Director.Name: Henry Selick
Director.Bio: Charles Henry Selick Jr. is an American film director, producer, screenwriter, production designer, and animator.

Title: John Wick
Description: A legendary hitman is forced out of retirement to seek revenge against the men who killed his puppy, a final gift from his recently deceased wife.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action is a film genre in which the protagonist is thrust into a series of events that typically involve violence and physical feats.

Director.Name: Chad Staelski
Director.Bio: Chad Staelski is an American stuntman and film director.

Title: Goldfinger
Description: James Bond investigates gold smuggling by gold magnate Auric Goldfinger, eventually uncovering Goldfinger's plans to contaminate the United States Bullion Depository at Fort Knox.

Genre.Name: Action
Genre.Description: Action is a film genre in which the protagonist is thrust into a series of events that typically involve violence and physical feats.

Director.Name: Guy Hamilton
Director.Bio: Mervyn Ian Guy Hamilton was an English film director. He directed 22 films from the 1950s to the 1980s, including four James Bond films.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Description: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Quentin Tarantino
Director.Bio: Quentin Tarantino is an American film director, writer, producer, and actor.

Title: American Psycho
Description: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Mary Harron
Director.Bio: Mary Harron is a Canadian filmmaker and screenwriter, and former entertainment critic.

Title: Selma
Description: A chronicle of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.'s campaign to secure equal voting rights via an epic march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, in 1965.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Ava DuVernay
Director.Bio: Ava Marie DuVernay is an American filmmaker and former film publicist.

Title: Nomadland
Description: A woman in her sixties, after losing everything in the Great Recession, embarks on a journey through the American West, living as a van-dwelling modern-day nomad.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Director.Name: Chloé Zhao
Director.Bio: Chloé Zhao is a Chinese film director, screenwriter, and producer.
